sprite

Class Sprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • sprite.Sprite
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HeavySprite, LightSprite

    public abstract class Sprite
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class used for Sprites

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Sprite(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bi) 
      Sprite(java.lang.String path)
      Will load the image from storage into memory.

    • Method Detail

      • getImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
        Retrieves the current frame of the animation tied to the sprite
        Returns:
        Current frame of the animation in the form of a Buffered Image

      • scaleImage

        public void scaleImage(double scaleValue)
        Used for scaling the image. It is better to use getScaled() in most cases.
        Parameters:
        scaleValue - Multiplier for image size

      • resizeImage

        public void resizeImage(int newWidth,
                        int newHeight)
        Used for creating a new image based on a predetermined size.
        Parameters:
        newWidth - The new width of the image
        newHeight - The new height of the image

      • rotateImage

        public void rotateImage(double degrees)
        Used for rotating the image (using degrees). All rotations are "Nearest Neighbor" rotations, allowing individual pixels to keep their relative form. The currentRotated() cardinalRotate() are better for general use.
        Parameters:
        degrees - Degrees in which the image is rotate.

      • reflectImage

        public void reflectImage()
        Reflects the image.

      • getScaled

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getScaled(double scalar)
        Returns scaled instance of the default image.
        Parameters:
        scalar - Multiplier in which the image will be scaled
        Returns:
        Scaled image

      • currentRotated

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage currentRotated(double angle)
        Returns a rotated instance of the default image.
        Parameters:
        angle - Angle (in degrees) the image will be rotated
        Returns:
        Rotated image

      • cardinalRotate

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage cardinalRotate(int direction)
        Returns a rotated instance of the default image based on a multiple of 90.
        Parameters:
        direction - The multiple of 90 in which the image will be rotated.
        Returns:
        Rotated image based on multiple of 90.

      • deepCopy

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage deepCopy(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bi)

        public abstract Sprite copy()
